title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Alex Galchenyuk Arrest

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: July 9, 2024
Location: Scottsdale, Arizona
Suspect: Alex Galchenyuk
Incident Summary: Alex Galchenyuk was arrested after allegedly fleeing the scene of a hit-and-run incident. Bodycam footage reportedly captures Galchenyuk making threats against officers and their families, using racial slurs, and resisting arrest. Officers detained him after locating his vehicle, where he continued to berate and threaten law enforcement during transport.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial hit-and-run incident.
Interacted with and detained Alex Galchenyuk.
Transported him to the police station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Sean Higgins Arrest

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: August 29, 2024
Location: Pennsville Auburn Road (County Route 551) near Stumpy Lane, Oldmans Township, NJ
Suspect: Sean Higgins, 44
Incident Summary: Sean Higgins was arrested following a crash that resulted in the deaths of Johnny Gaudreau and Matthew Gaudreau. Bodycam footage captures officers conducting a field sobriety test, Higgins admitting to consuming alcohol, and his subsequent arrest. Police report that Higgins' blood alcohol level was .087, above the legal limit.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Engaged with Sean Higgins at the crash scene.
Conducted the field sobriety test.
Took Higgins into custody and transported him.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Nikkita Brown Incident

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Nikkita Brown Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: August 28, 2024
Location: North Avenue Beach, Chicago, Illinois
Individual Involved: Nikkita Brown
Incident Summary: Bodycam footage captures a confrontation between Brown and a CPD officer after she was instructed to leave the closed beach area. The interaction escalated into a physical struggle, during which the officer attempted to detain Brown. The Civilian Office of Police Accountability (COPA) has since launched an investigation into the officer’s actions.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Engaged with Nikkita Brown at North Avenue Beach.
Were present during the altercation and physical struggle.
Recorded Brown’s interaction, including audio before, during, and after the encounter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Chongya Weldon Arrest

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Chongya Weldon Arrest
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: September 20, 2024
Individual Involved: Chongya Weldon
Incident Summary: Officers arrested Weldon at her home following allegations that she threw water on a plant shop owner on September 14, 2024. Bodycam footage reportedly captures the interaction between officers and Weldon, including her objections to the arrest and accusations that officers used excessive force. Weldon was charged with resisting an officer.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to Weldon’s residence on September 20, 2024.
Interacted with Weldon during her arrest.
Transported Weldon following her arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Trish Herrera Spencer Incident

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Trish Herrera Spencer Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: October 18, 2024
Location: Pine Avenue and East Broadway, Long Beach, California
Individual Involved: Trish Herrera Spencer
Incident Summary: Officers responded to reports of an intoxicated woman outside a bar, later identified as Trish Herrera Spencer. Officers noted she had a small injury near her eyebrow and was uncooperative with medical staff. The incident was initially treated as a medical matter rather than a criminal one. Spencer was later transported to a hospital for further evaluation.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the initial call regarding Spencer.
Interacted with Spencer at the scene and during her transport to the hospital.
Were present at the hospital where Spencer was treated.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P017454-022525
communications.communication:
Dear Harun Harun: Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 2/25/2025 and given the reference number P017454-022525 for tracking purposes. The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/ (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXQ3-2BSGsh7cY0TJBIWykFvHkj9IFdeNXJyTqJkWBzkrm5iJ6in3r0rehR-2BzDcOnERKd5L37lFmsu-2F8vnhVm05de8-3D9By__GrGQaoNrcltqgSmHWI-2BMVrJOdzc5l4CTpw5LFHKiDQCaI3u66AtmmW6M-2BPgXse-2F4Cp3TgWBXPbhAjncVo5zRi5dCghskl52anujvnL7STBZRu-2BZ4V8GiRYHV6aBcKoOC-2Fl7U10jAoi23PMoH6FPeY6mj1lZkz0hP5-2F7lUtxRCXkzxnIVQTuvc3gS6RD69OXLTJijKTVH3n68VaXlRrzuaRV18dUypNlfWcQE5kQUuM5OSNcRNEHgh15Iv1KZsn7HS03HkDbhhHhs-2BtldZpLEVHNIXEIZuNMWUYZgIPhaT7mrG9p-2Fz2gwAutZIZW53KBd-2FVPu1TJ5-2FcOMCdaOxRZtFf92Cw7jQfiotYHPOthXh6Md-2Frxt0ivTgU8GOBUOOLfJ6VKG4v-2Frpa9wN25-2FuSZ-2BlA-3D-3D) The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Volusia County Sheriff's Office,

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the assault on a school resource officer at Deltona Middle School on 11/1/2024.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 11/1/2024
Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
Suspects: Jorge Rivera (46) and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45)
Incident Summary: The suspects, parents of a student, allegedly attacked and punched a school resource officer after a dispute over their son being charged with battery. The officer was shoved, punched in the face, and suffered a concussion during the altercation.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the scene and interacted with the suspects during the incident and arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.communication:
Dear Harun Harun: 
Your request was received in this office on 2/25/2025 and given the reference number M000519-022525 for tracking purposes. Your request mentioned: 
"To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Volusia County Sheriff's Office,

I am writing to formally request access to the bodycam footage under the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) related to the assault on a school resource officer at Deltona Middle School on 11/1/2024.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 11/1/2024
Location: Deltona Middle School, Deltona, Florida
Suspects: Jorge Rivera (46) and Dagmarie Aponte Iturrino (45)
Incident Summary: The suspects, parents of a student, allegedly attacked and punched a school resource officer after a dispute over their son being charged with battery. The officer was shoved, punched in the face, and suffered a concussion during the altercation.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who responded to the scene and interacted with the suspects during the incident and arrest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fvolusia-county-sheriffs-office-7559%252Frequest-for-body-cam-footage-182100%252F%253Femail%253Dcustodianofrecords%252540vcso.us&url_auth_token=AAAQIsWBpkyaDfWyo9fNLYCmQqw%3A1tn7eO%3Ay2jDt_YbnZqCmgFiCq5MJpvpQbqWERgZvQjGqgVH7RI" 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. All requests are processed in the order in which they are received. 
Volusia Sheriff's Office Records Section

title: Use of MRAP vehicle (Prosper Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Prosper Police Department procured a Mine-Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) vehicle that was obtained through the Federal 1033 program. On June 1, 2024, their Facebook account invited the public to view the vehicle. Here is a news article on this event. 
https://www.nbcdfw.com/news/local/prosper-police-departments-emergency-vehicle/3560134/

I am requesting all recorded uses of this MRAP vehicle and any other vehicles that have been obtained through the Federal 1033 program. This included uses by both Prosper and Collin County's police/sheriff departments. It was mentioned in new reporting that the vehicle can help neighboring communities in Collin County. This request includes an use of the vehicle for community engagement, like the news article, and uses for emergency rescues. If this vehicle was used in other counties, please include their uses of the vehicle.

I request that I be properly classified as a news media requester. I am an investigative researcher for Bellingcat, and I am requesting this information in that capacity and request that fees be waived for this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kolina Koltai

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)

Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure

Overload Rates

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Minnich communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

All communications sent to and from Police Chief Dennis Minnich from January 28, 2025 through February 28, 2025. If this request is processed prior to February 28, please provide all communications through the date this request is processed. 

Records responsive to this request include all emails, recorded phone calls, and text messages related to government business and police department operations, including but not limited to all communications to and from the public, members of the town Select Board, and fellow officers. 

In order to better refine this request, your office may begin by providing metadata for communications sent to and from Chief Minnich, meaning a list (it can be a screen capture) of the name of the sender/interlocutor, the subject line of the email, and the date on which it was sent or received. Once this has been received, our team will provide an updated description for this request.

As required by archival regulations and the Massachusetts Public Records Law, please preserve all communications sent and received during this period, including all text messages, internal chats, and any other form of conversation.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you. 
 
Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook
 
I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:
 
How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?
 
For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable) 
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held 
Pay Grade 
Pay Ranges (Min& Max) 
Current Step (if on a step plan) 
Contract Length (in days and/or months) 
Annual Base Salary with no additives 
Annual Salary with any additives 
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent) 


Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available: 
 
Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)  
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements 
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?                           
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks 
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan 
Overload Rates 
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs  
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size?  If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution?  If yes, please provide details.
 
I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.
 
Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.
 
I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes



Evergreen Solutions

 

Very Respectfully,

 

Alisia Rios, MSIOP

Data Analyst – She/Her

 

Evergreen Solutions, LLC

2528 Barrington Circle Unit 201

Tallahassee, FL 32308

 

Office:   (850) 383-0111

Cell:       (850) 661-0341

Email:    alisia@consultevergreen.com

Partnering with public-sector clients to effect positive change

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: Evergreen Solutions
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Jennifer Cronkhite at my office received the below request. Our office is a private law firm representing educational institutions. However, we are not the officer for public information at any of those institutions and cannot accept public information requests on their behalf.

Please submit your request to Alvin Community College. I believe you can do so by clicking “Request for Public Information” at the following link: https://www.alvincollege.edu/about/consumer-information/index.html. The College may handle the request internally or ask for our assistance.

I hope this answers any questions. Please let me know if I can assist you further.

---

Kyle Stone
Senior Attorney
5718 Westheimer, Suite 1200
Houston, Texas 77057
Main:      713-960-6000
Direct:     713-960-6027
Fax:         713-960-6025
Website:  www.rmgllp.com<http://www.rmgllp.com/>
[signature_1955915938]

This email  (including any attachments)  may  contain  information that is private, confidential,  or protected by the attorney-client or other privilege. If you received this email in error,  please delete it from your system without copying it and notify the sender by reply email.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports received by the FAA based out of Hartsfield-Jackson International Airport in Atlanta, Georgia regarding an unidentified aerial phenomena (UAP) event between the hours of 2300 and 2359 on May 28, 2023, as reported by the crew of a Boeing 737-300ER that departed R26L for ORD and an Airbus crew arriving into ATL sometime before 2315. 

For reference, here is a record of the pilot’s version of events: https://nuforc.org/sighting/?id=176033.
